messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] simpsons' bedding
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Kelly, Can you get Simpson s material?  It would be easy to make a comforter from that.  I guess even a bedspread would be pretty easy to make!  (And,
messages.messageBody:
Hi Kelly,

Can you get Simpson's material? It would be easy to make a comforter from that. I guess even a bedspread would be pretty easy to make! (And, believe me, I'm a BASIC sewer!)

Teresa
Mumto5kidz :D
living in New Zealand
----- Original Message -----
From: kbcdlovejo@...
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, March 23, 2004 3:20 AM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] simpsons' bedding


I'm about exhausted looking for a bedspread/comforter on-line. Anybody got an
"in" to find this stuff?

Duncan's birthday present is a new bedroom. We're going from the cool
"Batcave" to a Simpsons room. I don't want the sheets 'cause too often they're made
of scratchy polyester, but curtains and a spread would be great. Cotton fabric
would be OK too, as I have a friend that sews.

I've googled ("the Simpsons" bedding) and other similar things----anybody?

Thanks!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] simpsons' bedding
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/22/2004 11:38:38 AM Eastern Standard Time, SandraDodd@aol.com writes: Can you get a picture of Bart s bed from the show and just make his
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/22/2004 11:38:38 AM Eastern Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:
Can you get a picture of Bart's bed from the show and just make his bed up
like Bart's? For documentation, you could frame the picture of Bart in his
bed
right above Duncan's bed. <<<<<

That's an idea.

I'd planned to paint the walls bright blue or something.

I have chalkboard paint, so I was going to paint one wall with that and put a
"full-sized" Bart next to it . He could write "I will not's" on the board as
he choses. Duncan wants a life-sized Homer with a beer can saying, "doh!" and
Lisa with books or a sax----all the family represented. We've thought of
writing on the walls a bunch of Simpson sayings.

Thanks for the website of the Simpson house. Unfortunately, I couldn't pull
up anything but the first page----but I'll keep trying.

Thanks, y'all!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

I WAS NOT TOLD TO DO THIS
--Bart Simpson

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] simpsons' bedding
messages.msgSnippet: ... Have you thought about doing the room to actually look like Bart s room, rather than using Simpson s character stuff? There was a real house built to look
messages.messageBody:
on 3/22/04 7:20 AM, kbcdlovejo@... at kbcdlovejo@... wrote:

> Duncan's birthday present is a new bedroom. We're going from the cool
> "Batcave" to a Simpsons room.


Have you thought about doing the room to actually look like Bart's room,
rather than using Simpson's character stuff?

There was a real house built to look just like the Simpson's house, in
Henderson Nevada, and given away in a contest. See
http://www.lasvegassun.com/dossier/misc/simpsons/index.html

You can see interior shots of Bart's room in the Photos and in the virtual
tour ;-)

Nancy

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] simpsons' bedding
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/22/04 8:22:44 AM, kbcdlovejo@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/22/04 8:22:44 AM, kbcdlovejo@... writes:

<< I'm about exhausted looking for a bedspread/comforter on-line. Anybody got
an
"in" to find this stuff? >>

Can you get a picture of Bart's bed from the show and just make his bed up
like Bart's? For documentation, you could frame the picture of Bart in his bed
right above Duncan's bed.

Sandra
